channel.title: Cache Downloader problem [PI]
channel.description:
I need help with my autocache downloader. I am currently using the BrokenX source. I have renamed the cache, and changed the download link to my cache. And yes, I'm using dropbox. Here's how it downloads. First it starts like this: [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture1.png[/img] It downloads 100%. This is what happens next. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture2-1.png[/img] This also downloads 100%, then this happens. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture3-1.png[/img] This is what it says in my command prompt. [CODE]GhettoScape is loading.. GhettoScapeCache.zip 71004630 java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:220) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:177) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:79) at client.startUp(client.java:8484) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:78) at client.startUp(client.java:8485) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:66) at Update.(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4466) at client.startUp(client.java:8495) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/CODE] And this is what is inside the cache that downloads. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture4-1.png[/img] And this is what the real cache looks like. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture5-1.png[/img] The server works when I manually insert the cache. It also works for my friend when he does the same. I have googled it, but I wasn't able to find any solutions. I found a guy that claims he fixed the problem, and I've messaged him, but he hasn't responded. Btw,this is a desktop client. Here is an approach that I was told to try, but it brought be back to where I started.
open ur cache folder ctrl+a right click Zip upload to dropbox copy public link enjoy.
I uploaded it, changed the link, and i'm back to where I started like I said earlier. I openned up the cache that it downloaded, and I found the cache inside it zipped. I openned it and everything was inside that o_o. It wasn't in the cache file itself though. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture4-1.png[/img] You see the zipped cache file inside the actual cache folder. It contains everything that is supposed to be in the cache. Any help is appreciated. Thanks.

item.title: Cache Downloader problem [PI]
item.dc:creator: @GrapeDrank GrapeDrank
item.description:
@GrapeDrank wrote:

I need help with my autocache downloader. I am currently using the BrokenX source. I have renamed the cache, and changed the download link to my cache. And yes, I’m using dropbox. Here’s how it downloads.

First it starts like this:

Capture1.png764×504

It downloads 100%. This is what happens next.
Capture2-1.png766×503

This also downloads 100%, then this happens.
Capture3-1.png765×503

This is what it says in my command prompt.

GhettoScape is loading.. GhettoScapeCache.zip 71004630 java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:220) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:177) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:79) at client.startUp(client.java:8484) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:78) at client.startUp(client.java:8485) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:66) at Update.<init>(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4466) at client.startUp(client.java:8495) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
And this is what is inside the cache that downloads.

And this is what the real cache looks like.

The server works when I manually insert the cache. It also works for my friend when he does the same. I have googled it, but I wasn’t able to find any solutions. I found a guy that claims he fixed the problem, and I’ve messaged him, but he hasn’t responded. Btw,this is a desktop client.

Here is an approach that I was told to try, but it brought be back to where I started.

open ur cache folder ctrl+a right click Zip upload to dropbox copy public link enjoy.

I uploaded it, changed the link, and i’m back to where I started like I said earlier.

I openned up the cache that it downloaded, and I found the cache inside it zipped. I openned it and everything was inside that o_o. It wasn’t in the cache file itself though.

You see the zipped cache file inside the actual cache folder. It contains everything that is supposed to be in the cache. Any help is appreciated. Thanks.

Read full topic
